issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

versions.description: Improved manageability and simplified client development process.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: server
components.description: General issues with the ZooKeeper server.

fields.description:
I have a group of zookeeper servers, there are three servers in this group.
server.0=10.81.4.11:2888:3888
server.1=10.23.240.93:2888:3888
server.2=10.23.244.224:2888:3888

At first, the cluster ran well.  About several days ago, I shut down the zookeeper process on one of servers(server.2)., and today, I find that the other two servers run in wired status(the network is fine). The zookeeper process take pretty much resource on the two servers:

on server.1 (it's the leader)
  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                                                                                                                               
26836 work      18   0 12.8g 803m 8724 S  3.7 10.1 195:56.56 java 

$ ll /proc/26836/fd/ | wc -l
3586

[work@tc-test-aos03.tc.baidu.com conf]$ ll /proc/26836/task/ | wc -l
10510

some warning log:

What's more, the number of threads under the zookeeper process is still increasing time by time. It seems that , something is wrong in communication of the two servers. Have anyone met such problem before?
fields.summary: the threads number of a zookeeper is increased all the time
fields.environment: Linux 2.6.9-52bs #2 SMP Fri Jan 26 13:34:38 CST 2007 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

comments.body: Looks like a dupe of ZOOKEEPER-880 to me. Can you take a look and give that patch a try (success has been reported by other users).

Hi Qian, Please have a look at ZOOKEEPER-880. Also, please consider uploading logs and snapshots separately instead of posting them on the description of the jira, just so that we don't get long descriptions with every update to the jira.

to Patrick:
thx, i'll take a look at it

to Flavio:
thx, i'll pay attention to it next time.
Since ZOOKEEPER-880 has been fixed, this one should also be closed since it was a duplicate.
Resolving as duplicate of ZOOKEEPER-880. thanks for pointing out Thomas!
